titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Shlomo Narinsky (Neroni) and Sonia Narinsky Postcard Album - Hisham Khatib Collection AD.MC.030_ref174
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Soliman and Emily Broad

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-02-03 19:14:49 +0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Shlomo Narinsky (Neroni) and Sonia Narinsky Postcard Album - Hisham Khatib Collection

physdesc.extent: 74 photogravures over 65 pages of an album. One newspaper clipping.

did.unittitle: The front cover of the "Shlomo Narinsky (Neroni) and Sonia Narinsky Postcard Album."
The table of contents of the "Shlomo Narinsky (Neroni) and Sonia Narinsky Postcard Album."
The text "The Holy Land, 1910-1921 Photogravures by S. Narinsky" by Tim N. Gidal.
(No. 3) The Tower of David (duplicate Ref5).
(No. 3) The Tower of David (duplicate Ref4).
(No. 53) A Bedouin and his pride (two duplicate portraits of a man with two horses (linked Ref23)).
(No. 14) The River Auja near Jeffa and the place of allied victories Palestine (two duplicate portraits of a man sitting near a tree, with the River Auja (Yarkon River) in the background).
(No. 16) The Ruins of Cesarea (a woman carrying a child at the beach at the beach at Qisarya/Cesarea (duplicate Ref38, 58)).
(No. 18) Mountains in Judean desert (Judaean Desert).
(No. 27) The Mountains of Gilead behind the River Jordan (linked Ref37).
(No. 30) Palm-trees forest near the River Kishon. Haifa. (A landscape of palm trees and hills in Haifa).
(No. 33) A Side view of Tiberias (a herd of animals on the shore of Lake Tiberias (Sea of Galilee), as a wagon passes on the adjacent road).
(No. 39) On the way to Bethlehem (two portraits of people herding sheep).
A studio portrait of a person wearing regional dress and holding a musical instrument.
(No. 44) Ibn El Sioud Bedouins (two duplicate portraits of two men, one holds a gun).

(No. 46) A Bedouin in his happy mood (a portrait of a man wearing regional dress (linked ref17,19,56)). Please note: This material has been digitized in its entirety and contains racist and culturally insensitive remarks.

(No. 50) Hebron with the minerets of its great mosque (duplicate Ref21) [original spelling maintained].
(No. 50) Hebron with the minerets of its great mosque (duplicate Ref20) [original spelling maintained].
(No. 48) A 110 years old Jew of Tiberias (a portrait of a man with beard).
(No. 53) A Bedouin and his pride (two duplicate portraits of the same man posed with two horses (linked Ref6)).
(No. 63) The Fountain of Khalifa Omar (a view of the Fountain of Khalifa Omar, with the Al-Aqsa Mosque in the background (duplicate Ref26,27)).
(No. 57) Steps leeding to the Christ's of the Holy Sepulchre (three men near the staircase leading to the Church of the Holy Sepulchre) [original spelling maintained].
(No. 63) The Fountain of Khalifa Omar (a view of the Fountain of Khalifa Omar, with the Al-Aqsa Mosque in the background (duplicate Ref24,27)).

(No. 67) Tyropean Valley (Dome of the Rock) (duplicate Ref29,30).

(No. 67) Tyropean Valley (Dome of the Rock) (duplicate Ref28,29).
(No.105) House of Simon the Tanner (a portrait of a person sitting on the niche of a building) [location unconfirmed].
(No. 73) Gethsemany (a view of the Garden of Gethsemane (duplicate Ref48)).
(No. 74) The Chapel of the Slaughter of the Infants (two views of the Chapel of the Milk Grotto (duplicate Ref59)).
